item.title: The Astronomy Behind the Gregorian Calendar
item.description: A clear explanation of how Earth’s orbit shaped the Gregorian calendar and why leap years keep our calendar aligned with the seasons.

item.title: Which Melts at a Higher Temperature?
item.description: A science-focused comparison of melting points, explaining why materials like iron and diamond behave differently under extreme heat and what determines their thermal limits.

item.description: A look at renewed missions to Venus and how studying its atmosphere and surface may help scientists better understand planetary evolution and climate processes.

item.title: Can Information Escape a Black Hole?
item.description: A clear overview of the black hole information paradox and the ongoing scientific debate about whether physical information is truly lost or preserved.

item.title: What’s Happening in Greenland?
item.description: A factual look at Greenland’s environment, including its ice sheets, climate patterns, and why scientists closely study this Arctic region for global insights.

item.title: The Moon’s Far Side Explained
item.description: A factual look at why the Moon’s far side isn’t truly dark, how it receives sunlight, and what makes it different from the side we see from Earth.

item.description: An engaging look at how geometric principles, developed thousands of years ago, continue to shape architecture, engineering, art, and modern science.
